page.title: 07Church Life-Sawbridgeworth
page.content: There are many different churches in Sawbridgeworth of which the largest is {St.Mary' s church}which stands in a central position where four pathways cross. They are used by people to get from their homes to the shops. It is a typical Hertfordshire church built of flint with a typical Hertfordshire "spike" . It has quite a thriving congregation with many activities going on to keep them involved. On the main London Road stands the {Congregational church.}It is a non conformist church unlike St. Mary's church which is a church of England. It runs many activities especially for children.On Station Road there stands {Hillside chapel,}of no particular denomination where services take place and a school meets on Sunday.In Bell Street is a small Pentecostal Church having regular Sunday services.
